summary: Build a fantasy sports app similar to Dream11.
known_issues: App stuck on initial loading spinner ("Get start" not responding); spinner never finishes (reported after ~2 minutes).

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and persist a user profile linked to the authenticated principal (display name, optional avatar selection) so users can use the app under their identity.
Implement the core fantasy flow: allow a signed-in user to pick a match, build a fantasy team from available players with role constraints, and save the team for that match.
Implement contests: allow users to browse contests for a match, join a contest with an existing team, and view their joined contests.

Add scoring and leaderboards suitable for an MVP: enable admins to enter per-player points for a match, compute each joined entry's team points (including captain/vice multipliers), and display contest leaderboards.

Create core frontend navigation and pages for the MVP: Home (sports/matches), Match Detail (players + team builder), Contests (list + join), My Teams, My Contests, Contest Detail (leaderboard), and Admin (seed data + scoring).

Define and apply a coherent visual theme for the app (distinct typography, color palette, spacing, and card-based layout) appropriate for a competitive fantasy sports product, and enforce it consistently across all pages.
Add generated static brand assets (logo + simple background) and render them in the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated without routing images through the backend.

Rebuild and deploy the existing FantasyXI application so it is accessible again after the previous draft expiry, keeping all current implemented Dream11-like MVP flows intact (authentication, matches, team building, contests, scoring, leaderboards, and admin seeding).
Ensure the required static brand images exist as generated assets and are available from the frontend without routing through the backend, using the exact filenames specified in project state.

Prevent the application from being stuck indefinitely on the initial full-screen loading spinner by adding a hard timeout to Internet Identity initialization; when the timeout is hit (or initialization throws), exit the initializing state and allow the app UI to render.

When Internet Identity initialization fails or times out, show a clear, user-facing error state with recovery actions instead of an endless spinner (e.g., “Failed to initialize authentication. Please refresh and try again.” with a “Retry” action).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a Dream11-like fantasy sports application (core fantasy contest experience).
Provide an MVP data model and admin/seed workflow in the backend for Sports, Matches, Players, and Contests without relying on external sports APIs (all data is created/managed in-app).

Add lightweight diagnostics for the startup/auth initialization path so the cause of slow/hung initialization can be identified in browser logs (e.g., log when initialization starts, when AuthClient is created, when isAuthenticated resolves, and when initialization ends or times out).
